results.title: 2001: A Space odyssey [DVD]
results.brief_description: Light years ahead of it’s time, Kubrick’s masterpiece has an awesome scope - his special effects border on miraculous. Inspired by Arthur C. Clarke’s epic book, 2001 moves from the prehistoric birth of intelligence to the emergence of the man as pure thought, somewhere in the future. Cast includes Keir Dullea and Gary Lockwood.

results.title: 2000 Today
results.creator_credit: Stewart Burchmore and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Share the excitement as we venture to all parts of Australia to welcome in the new millenium. Featuring highlights from spectacular fireworks across Australia, including Sydney Harbour, images from the Dawn Performance on the sails of the Sydney Opera House, the Woodford Fire Festival, and the traditional Aboriginal “Inma” ceremony and “Mimi” spirit stilt dance. The greatest celebration Australia has ever seen.

results.title: 200,000 reasons
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Andrew J. Helgeson, British Petroleum and Austral Pacific Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the life and work of some 27,000 members of the Surf Life Saving Association of Australia. Stresses the similarity between the surfer and the life-saver, and looks at the range of equipment used in rescue - jet boats, radios and 4-wheel drive vehicles. Includes scenes of training, competition and club life.

results.title: 200 cigarettes
results.creator_credit: Risa Bramon Garcia, Van Toffler, David Gale, Betsy Beers, Dogstar Films, MTV Films, Lakeshore Entertainment and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Lower Manhattan, New Year’s Eve, 1981, “200 Cigarettes” is an ensemble comedy/drama about a disparate group of twenty-somethings looking for love, sex and somewhere to party. Monica has planned a party but as the night wears on and no-one arrives she drinks, stresses and stews over her life. Her cousin Val and friend Stephie, wander around the city in search of the party, hooking up with two neo-punks Tom and Dave. Kevin bemoans his fate having been dumped the night before by performance artist Ellie, and is comforted by a friend Lucy, to whom he is forming an attraction. The film follows the dozen or so intended guests as they make their way to the party via taxis, nightclubs and cafes. The film has an episodic structure, seeking to lay patterns of interconnectedness amidst a slew of characters. However no real depth of scale and social meaning is ever achieved. Instead the characters remain frivolous and shallow - but with a hip eighties soundtrack and a top cast, the film is an amusing diversion. Features: Ben Affleck, Casey Affleck, Janeane Garofalo, Paul Rudd, Courtney Love, Martha Plimpton, David Chappelle, Kate Hudson, Jay Mohr, Christina Ricci.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Risa Bramon Garcia, Van Toffler, David Gale, Betsy Beers, Dogstar Films, MTV Films, Lakeshore Entertainment and Paramount Pictures

results.title: 20,000 leagues under the sea [study extract]
results.brief_description: From the book by Jules Verne. A breathtaking adventure aboard the “Nautilus”, the nuclear-powered submarine controlled by evil genius Captain Nemo. The cast includes James Mason, Kirk Douglas and Peter Lorne. The film prompts discussion about nuclear energy.

results.title: 20 years of African cinema = Camera d'Afrique: the young Arab cinema = Camera Arabe
results.brief_description: Shot on a low budget, ‘Camera d’Afrique’ chronicles 20 years of African, predominantly Francophone West African, cinema. The earliest film, ‘Borom Sarret’ (Ousmane Sembene) is from 1963, and ‘Finye’ (Souleymane Cisse), the most recent title from 1983. The documentary also covers the importance of Film Festivals in Tunis and Ouagadougou to African cinema, the debates of the Panafrican Film-Makers’ Federation (Fepaci), as well as the emergence of directors in the 1980’s. ‘Camera Arabe’, Boughedir’s second major documentary looks at the new Arab cinema of the post-colonial era, an era which owes its greatest debt to Egyptian director, Youssef Chahine. New Arab cinema must contend with Government influence and find itself an audience in an industry that is saturated with imported material. Boughedir interviews film-makers from North Africa as well as the wider Arab world and provides clips from a number of clips from key Arab films. On a critical level, ‘Camera Arabe’ investigates notions of memory, the role of women in Arab culture and the problematic identity of the Arab male.

results.title: 20 years @ Metro
results.brief_description:
From U-Matic Video and offline editing to digital media production and training this video tracks the history of community access to program making in Sydney. It includes interviews and footage of filmmakers Tom Zubrycki, David Caesar and Vincent Sheehan, broadcasters Steven Wall and Chris Winter and Filmink editor Dov Kornits who talk about starting out in video at Metro. It features early clips of Andrew Denton and Nicole Kidman and award winning films by indigenous filmmakers and young people from Metro’s youth access unit Channel Free.
Metro Screen began as the Paddington Video Access Centre in 1974, it incorporated as Metro Television Ltd in 1981 and organised the community television trials and was a key organisational player in he establishment of community television services. It became Metro Screen Ltd in 1998 and moved into digital video and interactive multimedia production and became a Registered Training Organisation.
Metro’s archive collection of community and independent programs represents over 27 years of documentaries, dramas and experimental videos. Communities who have not been represented in mainstream media - Aboriginals, gays and lesbians, young people and women present their communities, their issues and themselves.
The programs are products of exhaustive, laborious and triumphant collaborations between various individuals and community groups working within the spirit of a truly democratic and representative media.
In 2001 to celebrate 20 years at Metro, Metro Screen produced this 25 minute documentary using footage from the archive collection.
The next 20 years at Metro will build on the strengths of the past and continue to provide access and innovation in independent screen production and training top a wider regional and Western Sydney market through mobile and online services.

results.brief_description:
A couple running a grocery store is found murdered. The prime suspect is their own son, Jean-Michel, a brilliant student. When Elizabeth Massot meets the young man, she becomes intrigued by the relationship he had with his parents and starts drawing parallels between Jean-Michel’s situation and her own volatile relationship with son Guillaume.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writers, Claude Chabrol, Odile Barsky ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Didier Haudepin, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Michel Vitold, Bernadette Lafont, Mario David, Benoit Ferreux.

results.title: 2 Seconds = 2 secondes
results.creator_credit: Manon Briand, Roger Frappier, Studiofilms and Max Films
results.brief_description: Laurie (Charlotte Laurier) is a champion mountain bike racer whose career on the professional circuit comes to an abrupt end after hesitating for two seconds at the start of a race. Forced into retirement at 28, she moves to Montreal where she finds work as a bike courier. Her speed and passion for cycling impresses and threatens her colleagues as she weaves her way through traffic from one job to another. On one of her trips, a broken chain leads her to a bike store tucked away in a quiet street. There she meets the gruff Italian owner Lorenzo (Dino Tavarone), who was a cycling champion in his youth. Initially dismissive and suspicious of Laurie and her obsession with cycling, he slowly begins to trust her, recounting stories from his past on subsequent visits. Although Laurie and Lorenzo appear to move in different worlds, separated by age and gender, they gradually discover that essentially they have much in common, including their taste in women. Cast also includes Pascal Auclair, Yves Pelletier, Andre Brassard, Jici Lauzon and Louise Forestier. Photographed by James Gray; edited by Richard Comeau; music by Sylvain-Charles Grand and Dominique Grand. In French and English with English subtitles.
